title: Past Life Invisible
description: Daniel Haskin is known as an artist, musician, composer, writer and poet. His second book of poetry and verse, “Past Life Invisible”, is an anthology of poems that explore the human condition. In this anthology Haskin writes about death, loss and longing, rediscovery, and love in the deepest sense. Excerpt from "Muse" So, I will speak of your eyes Drawn on the occasion of our creation As my hands cast a slim shadow above Your delicate curves, etched in graphite And the colors of frozen fixed water Shading the shiny path of your dreams
author: Daniel Haskin
